intro: Pouzolzia courtallensis, commonly known as the Ceylon pouzolzia, is a climbing shrub native to Sri Lanka and parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and smartweeds. The plant has slender, woody stems that twine around supports and produce small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Pouzolzia courtallensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
